text:
SPEAKER: Pedro Arnt
is CEO of DLocal,

a publicly traded
payments processor founded
in Uruguay in 2017.

Today, with an annual run
rate of over $20 billion,

DLocal connects global
enterprise merchants

with billions of
emerging market consumers

across 40 countries in
Latin America, Africa,
and Southeast Asia.

PEDRO ARNT: This is very much
a purpose-driven organization.

We really are at the epicenter
of allowing emerging consumers
to bridge the digital divide.

If that gap isn't
bridged, then we

will continue to see a complete
disconnect between wealth

generation in the developed
world and the developing world.

On top of that, there's this
phenomenal investment thesis

that it's great
business to do that.

We are addressing a very clear
pain point for global merchants,

and that is how can I get
emerging consumers to pay?

In most emerging markets,
north of 50% of transactions
are still cash-based.

Over 80% are done
on non credit cards.

So this incredibly
fragmented scenario

requires very specific solutions
to be able to make sure

that these billions of
emerging market consumers

can actually pay for a
digital product or service.

We allow these
merchants to not have

to make those trade offs
between is an emerging

market worth the risk
reward, or is it not?

There's probably
three key elements.

One of them is make sure that
you commit to hiring locally.

But not necessarily in
your typical structure of I

have a local commercial
team, but to actually

make sure that the different
parts of the organization
have people locally.

The second one is to
make sure that the core

teams are consistently
traveling around the world.

We hire locally, but
we also send our people

very much to spend time
in the different markets.

We run a cultural practice
DLocal Houses, which

is the company will foot
the bill for any project

team of more than 10
people who chooses
to go somewhere in the globe.

And then the third element has
been a real firm commitment

to hire customer
support and sales
reps where our merchants are.

Because our merchant
base is global,

that's also pushed us to
have very decentralized sales

forces that are
listening to merchant

needs where the
merchants are, and that's
also a global distribution.

What's attracted me
to what we do really
is the mission statement.

It's unlocking the power
of emerging markets.

That really drives my
motivation when I wake up
every day in the morning.

To on top of that realize that
we can build this global company

with a phenomenal
financial model

almost brings together the
two ideal things for anyone
who wants to be an entrepreneur.
[UPBEAT MUSIC]
